name: Attribute Dictionary
description: The Attribute Dictionary defines schema attributes and includes references to the events and objects in which they are used.

name.name: Name
name.description: The name of the entity. See specific usage.

uid.name: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier. See specific usage.

category.name: Category
category.description: The original category of an event or object, as defined by the event source. See specific usage.

type.name: Type
type.description: The type of an object or value. See specific usage.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.description: The bitmask value that represents the file attributes.

access_complexity_id.name: Access Complexity
access_complexity_id.description: The access complexity Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) metric.

access_mask.name: Access Mask
access_mask.description: The access mask in platform-native format.

accessed_time.name: Accessed
accessed_time.description: The time that the file was last accessed.

accessor.name: Accessor
accessor.description: The name of the user who last accessed the object.

activity.name: User Activity
activity.description: The user activity related to the event.

activity_id.name: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The identifier of the activity that triggered the alert event.

-1.name: Other
-1.description: The event activity is not mapped.

actor_process.name: Actor
actor_process.description: The process that performed the operation or action on the target object. For example, the process that could have created a new file or violated a policy.

actual_permissions.name: Actual Permissions
actual_permissions.description: The permissions that were granted to the process.

algorithm.name: Algorithm
algorithm.description: The original hash algorithm, as reported by the event source, which was used to create the digital fingerprint.

algorithm_id.name: Algorithm ID
algorithm_id.description: The identifier of the normalized hash algorithm, whcih was used to create the digital fingerprint.

1.name: MD5
1.description: MD5 message-digest algorithm producing a 128-bit (16-byte) hash value.

2.name: SHA-1
2.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 1 producing a 160-bit (20-byte) hash value.

3.name: SHA-256
3.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 2 producing a 256-bit (32-byte) hash value.

4.name: SHA-512
4.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 2 producing a 512-bit (64-byte) hash value.

5.name: CTPH
5.description: The ssdeep generated fuzzy checksum. Also known as Context Triggered Piecewise Hash (CTPH).

answer_time.name: Answer Time
answer_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) answer time.

app_name.name: Application Name
app_name.description: The name of the application that is associated with the event or object.

app_uid.name: Application ID
app_uid.description: The unique identifier of the application that is associated with the event or object.

app_ver.name: Application Version
app_ver.description: The version of the application that is associated with the event or object.

assignee.name: Assignee
assignee.description: The name of the user who is assigned to the incident.

attack_vector_id.name: Attack Vector
attack_vector_id.description: The attack vector Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) metric.

attacks.name: Attacks
attacks.description: An array of attacks associated with an event.

auth_protocol.name: Auth Protocol
auth_protocol.description: The authentication protocol as reported by the event source.

auth_protocol_id.name: Auth Protocol ID
auth_protocol_id.description: The authentication protocol used to create the user session.

authentication_id.name: Authentication
authentication_id.description: The authentication Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) metric.

autoscale_uid.name: Autoscale ID
autoscale_uid.description: The unique identifier of the cloud autoscale configuration.

availability_impact_id.name: Availability Impact
availability_impact_id.description: The availability impact Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) metric.

banner.name: SMTP Banner
banner.description: The initial SMTP connection response that a messaging server receives after it connects to a email server.

base_address.name: Base Address
base_address.description: The memory address where the module was loaded.

bits.name: OS Bits
bits.description: The number of processor bits. For example: 64 or 128.

bytes.name: Total Bytes
bytes.description: The total number of bytes (in and out).

bytes_in.name: Bytes In
bytes_in.description: The number of bytes received on the source from the destination.

bytes_out.name: Bytes Out
bytes_out.description: The number of bytes sent from the source to the destination.

caption.name: Caption
caption.description: A short description or caption of the device. For example: "ATP Scanner 1 " or " CSP Manager".

categories.name: URL Categories
categories.description: An array of URL categories as defined by the event source.

category_id.name: Category ID
category_id.description: The category identifier of the event.

category_ids.name: URL Category IDs
category_ids.description: An array of URL category identifies.

-1.name: Other
-1.description: The URL category is not mapped. See the categories attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

channel.name: Channel
channel.description: The channel that was used to update the component.

cis20.name: CIS 20 List
cis20.description: The CIS 20 is a list of 20 actions and practices an organization’s security team can take on such that cyberattacks, or threats, are minimized and prevented.

class.name: Class
class.description: The class name of the event or object.

class_id.name: Class ID
class_id.description: The class identifier describes the attributes available in an event. See specific usage.

cmd_line.name: Command Line
cmd_line.description: The full command line used to launch an application, service, process, or job. For example: ssh user@10.0.0.10

command_ref_uid.name: Command Reference ID
command_ref_uid.description: The command identifier that corresponds to the original command identifier.

company_name.name: Company Name
company_name.description: The name of the company that published the file. For example: "Microsoft Corporation".

component.name: Component
component.description: The name or relative pathname of a sub-component of the data object, if applicable. For example: attachment.doc, attachment.zip/bad.doc, or part.mime/part.cab/part.uue/part.doc.

confidentiality_impact_id.name: Confidentiality Impact
confidentiality_impact_id.description: The confidentiality impact Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) metric.

connection_ref_uid.name: Connection Reference Identifier
connection_ref_uid.description: The external reference to a network connection identifier.

content_type.name: Content Type
content_type.description: The type of the content to which the update pertains.

content_ver.name: Detection Version
content_ver.description: The version of the detection engine or signature content.

coordinates.name: Coordinates
coordinates.description: A two-element array, containing a longitude/latitude pair. The format conforms with GeoJSON. For example: [-73.983, 40.719].

correlation_uid.name: Correlation ID
correlation_uid.description: The unique identifier used to correlate events.

count.name: Count
count.description: Aggregated events: the number of times that the event occurred during the Event Time to Event End Time period.

country.name: Country
country.description:
The ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code. For the complete list of country codes see ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes.

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: "US" or "CA".

create_mask.name: Create Mask
create_mask.description: The original Windows mask that is required to create the object.

create_mask_id.name: Create Mask ID
create_mask_id.description: The normalized Windows mask that is required to create the object.

created_time.name: Created
created_time.description: The time that the object was created. See specific usage.

creator.name: Creator
creator.description: The user that created the file.

creator_name.name: Creator Name
creator_name.description: The name of the user who created the incident.

curr_ver.name: Current Version
curr_ver.description: The updated version of the code, content, configuration or policy.

cve_uids.name: CVE ID's
cve_uids.description: The common vulnerabilities and exposures (CVE) identifiers.

cvssv2.name: CVSSV2
cvssv2.description: The Common Vulnerabilities Scoring System Version 2 (CVSS V2) base metrics.

data.name: Data
data.description: The additional data that is associated with the event or object. See specific usage.

days_left.name: Days Left
days_left.description: The number of days that remain before the license or certificate expires.

dc_region.name: Data Center Region
dc_region.description: The data center region, as defined by the cloud vendor.

desc.name: Description
desc.description: The description that pertains to the object or event. See specific usage.

detected_time.name: Detection Time
detected_time.description: The time that the threat was detected.

detection_uid.name: Detection ID
detection_uid.description: The associated unique detection event identifier. For example: detection response events include the Detection ID of the original event.

developer_uid.name: Developer ID
developer_uid.description: The developer ID on the certificate that signed the file.

device.name: Device
device.description: The device that reported the event.

direction_id.name: Direction
direction_id.description: The direction of the initiated connection or traffic.

displayed_text.name: Displayed Text
displayed_text.description: The information that is displayed to the user that describes the impact of a client side override action.

disposition.name: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition of the event, as defined by the event source.

disposition_id.name: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: The disposition ID of the event.

-1.name: Other
-1.description: The event disposition is not mapped.

dkim_domain.name: DKIM Domain
dkim_domain.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) signing domain of the email.

dkim_id.name: DKIM Status
dkim_id.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) status of the email.

dkim_signature.name: DKIM Signature
dkim_signature.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) signature used by the sending/receiving system.

dmarc_id.name: DMARC Status
dmarc_id.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) status of the email.

dmarc_override.name: DMARC Override
dmarc_override.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) override action.

dmarc_policy_id.name: DMARC Policy
dmarc_policy_id.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) policy.

dns_id.name: DNS ID
dns_id.description: The DNS packet identifier assigned by the program that generated the query. The identifier is copied to the response.

duration.name: Duration
duration.description: The event duration time, the amount of time the event covers from start `time` to `end_time` in milliseconds.

edition.name: OS Edition
edition.description: The operating system edition. For example: Professional.

effective_time.name: Effective Date
effective_time.description: The date and time that the specific policy and rule was applied and became operational.

email_auth.name: Email Authentication
email_auth.description: The SPF, DKIM and DMARC attributes of an email.

email_uid.name: Email ID
email_uid.description: The unique identifier of the email, used to correlate related email alert and activity events.

end_time.name: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period. See specific usage.

entity.name: Entity
entity.description: The managed entity that is being acted upon.

ether_type.name: EtherType
ether_type.description: The EtherType indicates which protocol is encapsulated in the payload of an Ethernet frame.

event_uid.name: Event UID
event_uid.description: The event UID identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_id * 1000 + disposition_id.

facility.name: Facility
facility.description: The subsystem or application that is providing the event data.

facility_detail.name: Facility Detail
facility_detail.description: Additional detail about the source facility. For example, details could include a the name of a particular application instance (such as a database name) or a path to a monitored log file.

facility_uid.name: Facility ID
facility_uid.description: The unique identifier of the facility.

feature.name: Feature
feature.description: The feature that reported the event.

file.name: File
file.description: The file that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

file_diff.name: File Diff
file_diff.description: File content differences used for change detection. For example, a common use case is to identify itemized changes within INI or configuration/property setting values.

file_result.name: File Result
file_result.description: The resulting file object. For example, if a file operation is allowed, the resulting file object can be included in the event.

fingerprints.name: Fingerprints
fingerprints.description: An array of fingerprint objects associated with the certificate.

first_seen_time.name: First Seen
first_seen_time.description: The initial detection time of the threat.

flag_ids.name: DNS Header Flags
flag_ids.description: The list of DNS answer header flag IDs.

-1.name: Other
-1.description: The event DNS header flag is not mapped.

flags.name: DNS Header Flags
flags.description: The list of DNS answer header flags.

folder.name: Folder
folder.description: The folder that pertains to the event.

folder_result.name: Folder Result
folder_result.description: The folder that is the result of the event.

from.name: From
from.description: The email header From values, as defined by RFC 5322.

full_name.name: Full Name
full_name.description: The full name of the entity.

gateway_ip.name: Gateway IP Address
gateway_ip.description: The gateway IP address. For example: "10.0.0.1".

gateway_mac.name: Gateway MAC Address
gateway_mac.description: The gateway media access control (MAC) address.

group.name: Group
group.description: The group object associated with an entity such as user, policy, or rule.

groups.name: Groups
groups.description: The groups to which user belongs.

hostname.name: Host Name
hostname.description: The hostname of an endpoint ot device

http_query.name: HTTP Query
http_query.description: The query portion of the URL. For example: the query portion of the URL http://www.example.com/search?q=bad&sort=date is q=bad&sort=date.

http_status.name: HTTP Status
http_status.description: The HTTP status code returned to the client.

http_user_agent.name: HTTP User-Agent
http_user_agent.description: The request header that is used to identify the operating system and web browser.

hw_bios_ver.name: BIOS Version
hw_bios_ver.description: The BIOS version. For example: "LENOVO G5ETA2WW (2.62)".

hw_cpu_type.name: Processor Type
hw_cpu_type.description: The processor type. For example: "x86 Family 6 Model 37 Stepping 5".

image.name: Image
image.description: The image used as a template to run a container or virtual machine.

imei.name: IMEI
imei.description: The International Mobile Station Equipment Identifier that is associated with the device.

incident_uid.name: Incident ID
incident_uid.description: If the event pertains to an incident, the incident unique identifier.

integrity_impact_id.name: Integrity Impact
integrity_impact_id.description: The integrity impact Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) metric.

interpreter.name: Interpreter
interpreter.description: The script interpreter used. For example: "CMD", "POWERSHELL", "VBSCRIPT", "JAVASCRIPT".

ip.name: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

ipv4.name: IPv4 Address
ipv4.description: The IPv4 address that is associated with the network interface.

ipv6.name: IPv6 Address
ipv6.description: The IPv6 address that is associated with the network interface.

is_advertised.name: Advertised
is_advertised.description: The indication of whether the protocol is advertised by the server.

is_cleartext.name: Cleartext Credentials
is_cleartext.description:
Indicates whether the credentials were passed in clear text.

Note: True if the credentials were passed in a clear text protocol such as FTP or TELNET, or if Windows detected that a user's logon password was passed to the authentication package in clear text.

is_compliant.name: Compliant Device
is_compliant.description: The event occurred on a compliant device.

is_default.name: Default Value
is_default.description: The indication of whether the value is from a default value name. For example, the value name could be missing.

is_managed.name: Managed Device
is_managed.description: The event occurred on a managed device.

is_on_premises.name: On Premises
is_on_premises.description: The indication of whether the location is on premises.

is_personal.name: Personal Device
is_personal.description: The event occurred on a personal device.

is_public.name: Public Network
is_public.description: The indication of whether the network interface is a public IP address.

is_remote.name: Remote
is_remote.description: The indication of whether the session is remote.

is_system.name: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

is_trusted.name: Trusted Device
is_trusted.description: The event occurred on a trusted device.

is_used.name: Used
is_used.description: The indication of whether the TLS is used.

is_user_present.name: User Present
is_user_present.description: The indication of whether the user was logged on at event generation time.

is_valid.name: Valid
is_valid.description: The indication of whether the certificate is valid.

isp.name: ISP
isp.description: The name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP).

job.name: Job
job.description: The job object that pertains to the event.

kernel.name: Kernel
kernel.description: The kernel resource object that pertains to the event.

key_length.name: Key Length
key_length.description: The length of the encryption key.

label.name: Label
label.description: The label set for the policy.

lang.name: Language
lang.description: The two letter lower case language codes, as defined by ISO 639-1. For example: "en" (English), "de" (German), or "fr" (French).

last_run_time.name: Last Run
last_run_time.description: The last run time of application or service. See specific usage.

last_updated_time.name: Last Updated
last_updated_time.description: The time when the event was last updated or enriched.

last_write_time.name: Last Written
last_write_time.description: The last write time. See specific usage.

load_type.name: Load Type
load_type.description: The load type describes how the module was loaded in memory.

load_type_id.name: Load Type ID
load_type_id.description: The load type identifies how the module was loaded in memory.

loaded_module_name.name: Loaded Module
loaded_module_name.description: The name of the module loaded by the service.

loaded_modules.name: Loaded Modules
loaded_modules.description: The list of loaded module names.

log_name.name: Log Name
log_name.description: The name of the database, index, or archive where the event was logged by the logging system.

log_time.name: Logged Time
log_time.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event Time in that event Time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.

2.name: Interactive
2.description: A local logon to device console.

3.name: Network
3.description: A user or device logged onto this device from the network.

4.name: Batch
4.description: A batch server logon, where processes may be executing on behalf of a user without their direct intervention.

5.name: Service
5.description: A logon by a service or daemon that was started by the OS.

8.name: Network Cleartext
8.description: A user logged on to this device from the network. The user's password in the authentication package was not hashed.

9.name: New Credentials
9.description: A caller cloned its current token and specified new credentials for outbound connections. The new logon session has the same local identity, but uses different credentials for other network connections.

10.name: Remote Interactive
10.description: A remote logon using Terminal Services or remote desktop application.

11.name: Cached Interactive
11.description: A user logged on to this device with network credentials that were stored locally on the device and the domain controller was not contacted to verify the credentials.

mac.name: MAC Address
mac.description: The Media Access Control (MAC)  address that is associated with the network interface.

mem_allocated.name: Allocated Memory
mem_allocated.description: The Java Virtual Machine® (JVM) allocated memory (in bytes).

mem_free.name: Free Memory
mem_free.description: The Java Virtual Machine® (JVM) free memory (in bytes).

mem_max.name: Maximum Memory
mem_max.description: The Java Virtual Machine® (JVM) maximum memory (in bytes).

message_id.name: Message ID
message_id.description: The email header Message-Id value, as defined by RFC 5322.

method.name: Method
method.description: The HTTP method used in the URL request.

mime_type.name: MIME type
mime_type.description: The Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) type of the file, if applicable.

modified_time.name: Modified
modified_time.description: The time when the object was last modified. See specific usage.

modifier.name: Modifier
modifier.description: The user who last modified the file.

modifier_name.name: Modifier Name
modifier_name.description: The name of the user who last modified the incident.

module.name: Module
module.description: The module that pertains to the event.

networks.name: Network Information
networks.description:
The network information objects that are associated with the device, one for each MAC address/IP address combination.

Note: The first element of the array is the network information that pertains to the event.

next_run_time.name: Next Run
next_run_time.description: The next run time. See specific usage.

normalized_path.name: Normalized Path
normalized_path.description: The CSIDL normalized path name. For example: CSIDL_SYSTEM\svchost.exe (Windows only).

num_network.name: Scanned Network Items
num_network.description: The number of network items scanned.

num_registry.name: Scanned Registry Items
num_registry.description: The number of registry items scanned.

num_resolutions.name: Resolutions
num_resolutions.description: The number of items that were resolved.

num_violations.name: Violations
num_violations.description: The number of times the policy or rule was violated.

opcode.name: DNS Opcode
opcode.description: The DNS opcode specifies the type of the query message.

open_mask_id.name: Open Mask
open_mask_id.description: The Windows setting that is required to open the object.

org_unit.name: Org Unit
org_unit.description: The name of the org unit to which the device belongs.

override_duration.name: Override Duration
override_duration.description: The length in minutes for the override action to remain in place until restored upon expiration of time. If not provided it implies infinite duration of policy enforcement or until such time as another policy action occurs.

owner.name: Owner
owner.description: The user that owns the file.

owner_email.name: Owner Email
owner_email.description: The email address of the data owner.

owner_name.name: Owner Name
owner_name.description: The name of the data owner.

packets.name: Total Packets
packets.description: The total number of packets (in and out).

packets_in.name: Packets In
packets_in.description: The number of packets received on the source from the destination.

packets_out.name: Packets Out
packets_out.description: The number of packets sent from the source to the destination.

parent_categories.name: Parent Categories
parent_categories.description: An array of parent URL categories.

parent_dir.name: Parent Folder
parent_dir.description: The parent folder in which the file resides. For example: c:\windows\system32

parent_process.name: Parent Process
parent_process.description: The parent process of the actor process.

path.name: Path
path.description: The path that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

pid.name: Process ID
pid.description: The process identifier, as reported by the operating system. Process ID (PID) is a number used by the operating system to uniquely identify an active process.

port.name: Port
port.description: The IP port number associated with a connection. See specific usage.

prev_ver.name: Previous Version
prev_ver.description: The pre-update version of the code, content, configuration or policy.

print_job.name: Print Job
print_job.description: The name of the print or FAX job.

priority.name: Priority
priority.description:
The original event priority, as defined by the event source.

Priority identifies the relative importance of an incident or event. It is a measurement of urgency.

priority_id.name: Priority ID
priority_id.description:
The normalized event priority identifier.

Priority identifies the relative importance of an incident or event. It is a measurement of urgency.

1.name: Low
1.description: Application or personal procedure unusable, where a workaround is available or a repair is possible.

2.name: Medium
2.description: Non-critical function or procedure, unusable or hard to use having an operational impact, but with no direct impact on services availability. A workaround is available.

3.name: High
3.description: Critical functionality or network access interrupted, degraded or unusable, having a severe impact on services availability. No acceptable alternative is possible.

4.name: Critical
4.description: Interruption making a critical functionality inaccessible or a complete network interruption causing a severe impact on services availability. There is no possible alternative.

-1.name: Other
-1.description: The priority is not mapped. See the priority attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

product.name: Product
product.description: The product that reported the event.

protocol_name.name: Protocol Name
protocol_name.description: The IP protocol name in lowercase, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). See Protocol Numbers. For example: tcp and udp.

protocol_num.name: Protocol Number
protocol_num.description: The IP protocol number, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). See Protocol Numbers. For example: 6 for TCP and 17 for UDP.

provider.name: Provider
provider.description: The origin of the reputation and category information.

proxy.name: Proxy
proxy.description: If a proxy connection is present, the connection from the client to the proxy server.

public_ip.name: Public IP
public_ip.description:
The public IP address.

Note: The Device Public IP is populated with the value of the x-forwarded-for message header, if present.

.

quarantine_uid.name: Quarantine ID
quarantine_uid.description: The unique identifier of the item that was quarantined or restored from quarantine.

query_time.name: Query Time
query_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) query time.

raw_data.name: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The event data as received from the event source.

recovery_key_uid.name: Recovery Key ID
recovery_key_uid.description: The unique identifier of the recovery key of the volume.

ref_event_name.name: Source Event Name
ref_event_name.description: The event name, as defined by the event source.

ref_event_uid.name: Source Event ID
ref_event_uid.description: The event identifier, as defined by the event source. For example, the Windows event ID.

ref_incident_uid.name: Source Incident ID
ref_incident_uid.description: The unique incident identifier, as defined by the event source.

ref_uid.name: Source Event UUID
ref_uid.description: The unique event identifier of the event instance, as defined by the event source.

referrer.name: Referrer
referrer.description: The address accessed prior to this one.

reg_key_result.name: Registry Key Result
reg_key_result.description: The result of a registry key change.

reg_value_result.name: Registry Value Result
reg_value_result.description: The result of a registry value change.

region.name: Region
region.description: The alphanumeric code that identifies the principal subdivision (e.g. province or state) of the country. Region codes are defined at ISO 3166-2 and have a limit of three characters. For examples, see the region codes for the US.

rep_score.name: Reputation Score
rep_score.description: The original reputation score as reported by the event source.

4.name: Leans Safe
4.description: Starting to establish a history of normal behavior.

5.name: May not be Safe
5.description: No established history of normal behavior.

6.name: Exercise Caution
6.description: Starting to establish a history of suspicious or risky behavior.

-1.name: Other
-1.description: The reputation score is not mapped. See the rep_score attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

reply_to.name: Reply To
reply_to.description: The email header Reply-To values, as defined by RFC 5322.

request_headers.name: Request Headers
request_headers.description: The additional information associated with and HTTP request.

requested_permissions.name: Requested Permissions
requested_permissions.description: The permissions that were requested by the process.

resource_type.name: Resource Type
resource_type.description: The context in which a resource was retrieved in a web request.

response_headers.name: Response Headers
response_headers.description: The additional information associated with and HTTP response.

risk.name: Risk
risk.description: The Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) calculated risk.

rule.name: Rule
rule.description: The rules that reported the events.

rules.name: Rules
rules.description: The additional rules that are associated with the policy.

run_as.name: User
run_as.description: The user account the process is running as.

run_state.name: State
run_state.description: The state of the job or service. See specific usage.

run_state_id.name: State ID
run_state_id.description: The state of the job or service. See specific usage.

sandbox.name: Sandbox
sandbox.description: The name of the containment jail (i.e., sandbox). For example, hardened_ps, high_security_ps, oracle_ps, netsvcs_ps, or default_ps.

scan_name.name: Scan Name
scan_name.description:
The administrator-supplied or application-generated name of the scan. For example:
  • "Home office weekly user database scan"
  • "Scan folders for viruses"
  • "Full system virus scan"

scan_uid.name: Scan ID
scan_uid.description: The unique identifier of a scan job.

schedule_uid.name: Schedule ID
schedule_uid.description: The unique identifier of the schedule associated with a scan job.

scheme.name: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme portion of the URL. For example: "http", "https", "ftp" or "sftp".

sender_email.name: Sender Email
sender_email.description: The email address of the sender.

sender_hostname.name: Sender Host Name
sender_hostname.description: The host name of the sending email server.

sender_ip.name: Sender IP Address
sender_ip.description: The IP address of the sender, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

sequence.name: Sequence Number
sequence.description: Sequence number of the event. The sequence number is a value available in some events, to make the exact ordering of events unambiguous, regardless of the event time precision.

serial.name: Serial Number
serial.description: The serial number that pertains to the object. See specific usage.

service.name: Service
service.description: The service that pertains to the object.

session.name: Session
session.description: The authentication session object that pertains to the event.

session_uid.name: Session ID
session_uid.description: The unique ID of the user session, as reported by the OS.

severity.name: Severity
severity.description:
The original event severity, as defined by the event source.

The severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident.

severity_id.name: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized event severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

0.name: Unknown
0.description: The event severity is not known.

2.name: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.name: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

5.name: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.name: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

-1.name: Other
-1.description: The event severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

signature.name: Digital Signature
signature.description: The digital signature of the file.

size.name: Size
size.description: The size of data, in bytes.

smtp_from.name: SMTP From
smtp_from.description: The value of the SMTP MAIL FROM command.

smtp_hello.name: SMTP Hello
smtp_hello.description: The value of the SMTP HELO or EHLO command.

smtp_to.name: SMTP To
smtp_to.description: The value of the SMTP envelope RCPT TO command.

source.name: Source
source.description: The monitored source that originated the event.

sp_name.name: OS Service Pack
sp_name.description: The name of the latest Service Pack.

sp_ver.name: OS Service Pack Version
sp_ver.description: The version number of the latest Service Pack.

spf_id.name: SPF Status
spf_id.description: The Sender Policy Framework (SPF) status of the email.

ssid.name: SSID
ssid.description: The name of the wireless network, or Service Set Identifier (SSID).

start_time.name: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period. See specific usage.

start_type.name: Start Type
start_type.description: The start type of the service or startup application.

start_type_id.name: Start Type ID
start_type_id.description: The start type ID of the service or startup application.

3.name: Demand
3.description: Started on demand. For example, by the Window service control manager when a process calls the Startservice function.

7.name: Specific User Login
7.description: Started when on a specific user login.

10.name: System Changed
10.description: Started when a system item, such as a file or registry key, changes.

-1.name: Other
-1.description: The start type is not mapped. See the start_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

startup_app.name: Startup Application
startup_app.description: The startup application that pertains to the event.

state.name: State
state.description: The state of the event or object, as defined by the event source. See specific usage.

state_id.name: State ID
state_id.description: The state ID of the event or object. See specific usage.

state_ids.name: States
state_ids.description: The states of the event or object. See specific usage.

status.name: Status
status.description: The event status, as defined by the event source.

-1.name: Other
-1.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

status_stack_trace.name: Stack Trace
status_stack_trace.description: The list of calls that the application was making when an exception was thrown.

subject.name: Subject
subject.description: The email header Subject value, as defined by RFC 5322.

subnet.name: Subnet
subnet.description: The subnet IP address. For example: "255.0.0.0".

subnet_uid.name: Subnet ID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of the virtual subnet.

svc_name.name: IANA Service Name
svc_name.description: The service name, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). See Service Name and Transport Protocol Port Number Registry.

system_call.name: System Call
system_call.description: The system call that was invoked.

tactics.name: Tactics
tactics.description: The a list of tactic ID's that are associated with the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

tag.name: Image Tag
tag.description: The container image tag. For example: 1.11-alpine.

tcp_flags.name: TCP Flags
tcp_flags.description: The network connection TCP header flags (i.e., control bits).

technique_name.name: Technique Name
technique_name.description: The name of the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: Drive-by Compromise.

technique_uid.name: Technique ID
technique_uid.description: The unique identifier of the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: T1189.

threat.name: Threat
threat.description:
The primary threat identified by the event.

Note: The primary threat may be the first threat found by the detection engine, or it may be the most severe threat found. The client determines the primary threat.

threats.name: Threats
threats.description: The additional threats that were detected.

throughput_eps.name: Events per Second
throughput_eps.description: The number of events processed per second.

throughput_kbps.name: Kilobytes per Second
throughput_kbps.description: The number of kilobytes of data processed per second (kB/s).

tid.name: Thread ID
tid.description: The Identifier of the thread associated with the event, as returned by the operating system.

time.name: Time
time.description:
The event occurrence time.

This is the time extracted from the event, representing when the event was generated by the event source.

timezone.name: Time Zone
timezone.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC. A number in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

to.name: To
to.description: The email header To values, as defined by RFC 5322.

total.name: Total
total.description: The total number of items. See specific usage.

traffic.name: Traffic
traffic.description: The network traffic object that pertains to the event.

ttl.name: TTL
ttl.description: The time interval that the resource record may be cached. Zero value means that the resource record can only be used for the transaction in progress, and should not be cached.

type_id.name: Type ID
type_id.description: The type identifier of an object. See specific usage.

-1.name: Other
-1.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

5.name: Own Process
5.description: The application runs in its own process

6.name: Shared Process
6.description: The application shares a process with other services

7.name: Interactive
7.description: The service can interact with the desktop

9.name: Autoload
9.description: The Mac OS X Autoload Application

-1.name: Other
-1.description: The service type is not mapped. See the types attribute, which contains a data source specific values.

unmapped.name: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attribute are specific to the event source.

url.name: URL
url.description: The URL object that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

user.name: User
user.description: The user that pertains to the event or object.

users.name: Users
users.description: The users that belong to the administrative group.

uuid.name: Event Unique ID
uuid.description: The logging system-assigned unique identifier of an event instance.

value.name: Value
value.description: The value that pertains to the object. See specific usage.

vendor.name: Vendor
vendor.description: The vendor that pertains to the object. See specific usage.

version.name: Version
version.description: The version that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

vhost.name: Virtual Host Type
vhost.description: The device virtual host type string.

vhost_id.name: Virtual Host Type ID
vhost_id.description: The device virtual host type identifier.

volume_uid.name: Volume ID
volume_uid.description: The unique identifier of the volume.

vpc_uid.name: VPC ID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

xattributes.name: Extended Attributes
xattributes.description:
An unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs where each pair represents a file or folder extended attribute.

For example: Windows alternate data stream attributes (ADS stream name, ADS size, etc.), user-defined or application-defined attributes, ACL, owner, primary group, etc. Examples from DCS:

  • ads_name
  • ads_size
  • dacl
  • owner
  • primary_group
  • link_name - name of the link associated to the file.
  • hard_link_count - the number of links that are associated to the file.

zone.name: Network Zone
zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment.

types.name: Data Types
types.description: The predefined data types. The data type of an value specifies what kind of data that value can have.

hostname_t.name: Hostname
hostname_t.description: A unique name assigned to a device that is connected to a specific computer network. For example: r2-d2.example.com.

ip_t.name: IP Address
ip_t.description: Internet Protocol address (IP address), in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

ipv4_t.name: IPv4 Address
ipv4_t.description: Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) address. For example: 10.1.22.42.

ipv6_t.name: IPv6 Address
ipv6_t.description: Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) address. For example: 2345:0425:2CA1:0000:0000:0567:5673:23b5.

json_t.name: JSON
json_t.description: Embedded JSON value. A value can be a string, or a number, or true or false or null, or an object or an array. These structures can be nested. See www.json.org.

mac_t.name: MAC Address
mac_t.description: Media Access Control (MAC) address. For example: 18:36:F3:98:4F:9A.

path_t.name: Path Name
path_t.description: File or folder full path name. For example: /home/user/tmp/text-file.txt.

port_t.name: IP Port
port_t.description: IP TCP/UDP port number. For exaple: 80 or 22.

subnet_t.name: Subnet
subnet_t.description: Subnet mask in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation. For example 192.168.200.0/24.

timestamp_t.name: Timestamp
timestamp_t.description: The time format is the number of milliseconds since the Epoch 01/01/1970 00:00:00 UTC. For example 1618524549901.
